Tasting Notes from Cork’d Members

Firesteed 2003 Pinot Noir
(168 days ago) simplebits
This is probably my favorite every day (well, not every day) wine. It's light, subtly sweet, ripe fruit, slightly spicy oak. It's a bit "slippery", if that makes sense (in a very good way). Highly drinkable.

Tasting Tags: berry fruit oak ripe slippery spice sweet

Firesteed 2003 Pinot Noir
(166 days ago) absquatulate
A lovely pinot noir that I recommend to my friends who want something more sophisticated. Versatile with a wide variety of dishes. Not too sweet, and not too dry, it's a red that even white drinkers seem to like!

Tasting Tags:

Firesteed 2003 Pinot Noir
(165 days ago) adactio
This is a really nice wine that, for me, epitomises the Oregon taste. It's more full-bodied than some other Pinot Noirs, making it a really good wine to have with red meat like lamb or a filet steak. It isn't always easy to come by over here in Europe, but whenever I'm the States, I always keep an eye out for this (or Big Fire; possibly my favourite Oregon Pinot Noir).

Tasting Tags: full-bodied

Firesteed 2003 Pinot Noir
(162 days ago) panoptos
Very enjoyable with no harsh aftertaste. Medium body. I suppose that's true of most Pinot Noirs, but this one is neither too sweet nor too punchy. I like to try different Pinot Noirs but in between the ones I'm trying for the first time, I always return to Firesteed. It's a very good value.

Tasting Tags: balanced
